lexUnit.name: plummet.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move down rapidly on a scale

sentence.text: Between 1971 and 1980 local authority and new town completions averaged 143,000 dwellings a year , but in 1981 the figure plummeted to 68,000 and in 1987 it reached an all-time low of 22,000 .
BRIAN MULRONEY has turned out to be one of the most unloved prime ministers in recent Canadian history -- his popularity had plummeted by the time he decided to resign .
During the ten years up to 1989 , the African elephant population plummeted from 1.3 million to just over half a million .
Share trading collapsed , the gold price plummeted and the black market for dollars vanished .
Land prices plummeted as Hindus as well as Sikhs left the state to escape violence .
But the same year cotton prices plummeted on the world market from 68 cents to 34 cents a pound .
He could n't understand what was going wrong -- although the economic climate was improving , his profits were plummeting .
Our shares plummeted because the City felt we had taken a great risk .
Four days previously we had arrived on the glacier to set up the tent and learned a lot during that long , cold night , when temperatures plummeted to 25 deg C below .
Since then the Exchange Rate value of Sterling has plummeted .
The London firms ' revenues plummeted by a third from 1989 's level .
On April 2 share prices fell by almost 2,000 points as the Nikkei Average index plummeted by 1,987.30 points to close at 28,002.07 ( compared with a record high of 38,915.87 on Dec. 29 , 1989 ) .
Total emissions of lead have plummeted from 127,900 tonnes in 1978 to 7200 tonnes in 1989 ( figure 8.12 ; table 8.5 ) .
Car phones lost popularity when portable handsets plummeted from will into four figures to under £300 and became available with in-car adapters .
The Green Party is facing severe financial crisis after membership has plummeted from last year 's record high .
But since the failure of her marriage to Prince Charles she has plummeted in popularity .
His initial high hopes of a clear-cut solution to the Wetherby murder were plummeting in direct relation to his blood sugar .
And the price of big houses like that has really plummeted in the last year .
An inevitable consequence was a rapid run down in the stock of Catholic Colleges as registered student numbers plummeted to 3,000 by 1980 .
His pay packet as Tory MP for Putney will plummet to £32,193 .

Meanwhile , the Irish Junior Three Day Event Team has plummeted to fifth position after speed and endurance at the Coca Cola Junior European three-day event championship held at Loughanmore , Templepatrick this weekend .
Death rates plummeted as food flooded in .

Since coming to office in late 1990 , the National Party 's standing in the polls had plummeted as the government reneged on its electoral pledges by initiating radical cuts in the country 's welfare state .

And given that total hardware sales plummeted by 19.4% to $5,740m in the quarter , keeping the overall decline to 7% was an achievement in itself , even if within a quarter or three , turnover can be expected to start declining at an accelerating pace .

During the winter months when snow is seldom absent and the temperature can plummet to -40°C , the mission travelled about 1,500 miles across Siberia to Yeniseysk , at which they turned south-east and followed the wild , raging Angara River for 1,300 miles through deep-cut , tree-clad highlands to Irkutsk and the magnificent Lake Baykal .
In Japan , sales have plummeted 20 per cent during that period , while European sales have fallen 12 per cent .
The standing of both the monarchy and the law has plummeted .
Values of many homes plummeted after they were included on provisional lists .
He lost all movement in his limbs , was unable to swallow food and his weight plummeted .
Attendance plummeted as projected crowds dissipated even faster than popular fervour for Expo itself .
Temperatures plummeted 20 degrees so they clapped harder .
But even as house prices plummeted the Government hopelessly overestimated the number of homes in the high bands .
